Firewall Service

NOTICE:

The namespace prefix http://cisco.com/jnap/ has been deprecated but is still supported. All JNAP clients should switch to the new namespace prefix http://linksys.com/jnap/.

Change History

Revision Date Notes
2.0.0 2019-07-17 Added Firewall2 service to indicate the following actions now require authentication:
  • GetFirewallSettings
  • GetDMZSettings
  • GetALGSettings
  • GetSinglePortForwardingRules
  • GetPortRangeForwardingRules
  • GetPortRangeTriggeringRules
  • GetIPv6FirewallRules

Services

Firewall

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/Firewall
This service provides access to firewall settings on a router.

Service Actions

  • GetALGSettings
  • GetDMZSettings
  • GetFirewallSettings
  • GetIPv6FirewallRules
  • GetPortRangeForwardingRules
  • GetPortRangeTriggeringRules
  • GetSinglePortForwardingRules
  • SetALGSettings
  • SetDMZSettings
  • SetFirewallSettings
  • SetIPv6FirewallRules
  • SetPortRangeForwardingRules
  • SetPortRangeTriggeringRules
  • SetSinglePortForwardingRules

Firewall2

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/Firewall2
This service provides access to firewall settings on a router.

Service Actions

  • GetALGSettings
  • GetDMZSettings
  • GetFirewallSettings
  • GetIPv6FirewallRules
  • GetPortRangeForwardingRules
  • GetPortRangeTriggeringRules
  • GetSinglePortForwardingRules
  • SetALGSettings
  • SetDMZSettings
  • SetFirewallSettings
  • SetIPv6FirewallRules
  • SetPortRangeForwardingRules
  • SetPortRangeTriggeringRules
  • SetSinglePortForwardingRules

Actions

GetALGSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/GetALGSettings
This action gets the router's current ALG settings.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

This action does not have any input parameters.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
isSIPEnabled bool no Whether the router's SIP ALG feature is currently enabled.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/GetALGSettingsResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/GetALGSettings"

{
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "isSIPEnabled": true
  }
}

GetDMZSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/GetDMZSettings
This action gets the router's current DMZ settings.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

This action does not have any input parameters.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
isDMZEnabled bool no Whether the router's DMZ feature is currently enabled.
sourceRestriction DMZSourceRestriction yes The range of IP addresses that can access the destination server in the DMZ. If the value of the isDMZEnabled parameter is false, this value will not be present. If the value of the isDMZEnabled parameter is true and the sourceRestriction parameter is not present, all IP addresses are allowed to access the destination server.
destinationIPAddress IPAddress yes The destination server's IP address on the LAN. If the value of the isDMZEnabled parameter is false, this value will not be present. Otherwise, it will be present if and only if the destinationMACAddress parameter is not present. This value must be in the same subnet as the router's LAN host address (as defined by SetLANSettings), but not equal to the router's LAN host address and not fall inside the following reserved ranges:
Address Block Description Reference
192.168.1.0/24: 192.168.1.0 Subnetwork ID RFC 922, Section 7
192.168.1.0/24: 192.168.1.255 Subnetwork Broadcast Address RFC 922, Section 7
destinationMACAddress MACAddress yes The destination server's MAC address. If the value of the isDMZEnabled parameter is false, this value will not be present. Otherwise, it will be present if and only if the destinationIPAddress parameter is not present.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/GetDMZSettingsResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/GetDMZSettings"

{
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "isDMZEnabled": true,
    "sourceRestriction": {
      "firstIPAddress": "192.168.10.1",
      "lastIPAddress": "192.168.11.1"
    },
    "destinationIPAddress": "192.168.1.200"
  }
}

GetFirewallSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/GetFirewallSettings
This action gets the router's current firewall settings.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

This action does not have any input parameters.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
isIPv4FirewallEnabled bool no Whether the IPv4 firewall is currently enabled.
isIPv6FirewallEnabled bool no Whether the IPV6 firewall is currently enabled.
blockMulticast bool no Whether the firewall currently blocks multicasts.
blockNATRedirection bool no Whether the firewall currently blocks NAT redirections.
blockIDENT bool no Whether the firewall currently blocks IDENT requests (port 113).
blockAnonymousRequests bool no Whether the firewall currently blocks anonymous requests from the WAN, such as ping.
blockIPSec bool no Whether the firewall currently blocks IPSec traffic.
blockPPTP bool no Whether the firewall currently blocks PPTP traffic.
blockL2TP bool no Whether the firewall currently blocks L2TP traffic.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/GetFirewallSettingsResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/GetFirewallSettings"

{
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "isIPv4FirewallEnabled": true,
    "isIPv6FirewallEnabled": true,
    "blockMulticast": false,
    "blockNATRedirection": false,
    "blockIDENT": true,
    "blockAnonymousRequests": true,
    "blockIPSec": true,
    "blockPPTP": true,
    "blockL2TP": true
  }
}

GetIPv6FirewallRules

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/GetIPv6FirewallRules
This action gets the list of rules regarding port/protocol combinations that are allowed to reach specific IPv6 destinations on the LAN through the firewall.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

This action does not have any input parameters.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
rules IPv6FirewallRule[] no The current list of IPv6 firewall rules.
maxPortRanges int no The maximum number of port ranges that can be specified by a single IPv6 firewall rule.
maxDescriptionLength int no The maximum length, in bytes, of the description member of an IPv6 firewall rule.
maxRules int no The maximum number of IPv6 firewall rules that can exist simultaneously.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/GetIPv6FirewallRulesResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/GetIPv6FirewallRules"

{
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "rules": [
      {
        "isEnabled": true,
        "ipv6Address": "2001:0DB8:85A3:0000:0000:8A2E:0370:7334",
        "portRanges": [
          {
            "protocol": "TCP",
            "firstPort": 3000,
            "lastPort": 3001
          }
        ],
        "description": "ports 3000-3001"
      }
    ],
    "maxPortRanges": 2,
    "maxDescriptionLength": 64,
    "maxRules": 15
  }
}

GetPortRangeForwardingRules

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/GetPortRangeForwardingRules
This action gets the list of port range forwarding rules currently set on the router.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

This action does not have any input parameters.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
rules PortRangeForwardingRule[] no The current list of port range forwarding rules.
maxDescriptionLength int no The maximum length, in bytes, of the description member of a port range forwarding rule.
maxRules int no The maximum number of port range forwarding rules that can exist simultaneously.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/GetPortRangeForwardingRulesResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/GetPortRangeForwardingRules"

{
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "rules": [
      {
        "isEnabled": true,
        "firstExternalPort": 6888,
        "lastExternalPort": 6900,
        "protocol": "Both",
        "internalServerIPAddress": "192.168.1.150",
        "description": "BitTorrent"
      }
    ],
    "maxDescriptionLength": 12,
    "maxRules": 15
  }
}

GetPortRangeTriggeringRules

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/GetPortRangeTriggeringRules
This action gets the list of port range triggering rules currently set on the router.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

This action does not have any input parameters.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
rules PortRangeTriggeringRule[] no The current list of port range triggering rules.

maxRules int no The maximum number of port range triggering rules that can exist simultaneously.

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/GetPortRangeTriggeringRulesResult

_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/GetPortRangeTriggeringRules"

{
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK

  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "rules": [
      {
        "isEnabled": true,
        "firstTriggerPort": 12000,
        "lastTriggerPort": 12050,
        "firstForwardedPort": 12000,
        "lastForwardedPort": 12050,
        "description": "custom"
      }
    ],
    "maxDescriptionLength": 12,
    "maxRules": 15
  }
}

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1

Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8

    "maxRules": 20
  }

SetDMZSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/SetDMZSettings
This action sets the router's DMZ settings.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
isDMZEnabled bool no Whether the router's DMZ feature should be enabled.
sourceRestriction DMZSourceRestriction yes The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to access the destination server in the DMZ. If the value of the isDMZEnabled parameter is false, this value is ignored. Otherwise, if this value is not present, all IP addresses will be allowed to access the destination server.
destinationIPAddress IPAddress yes The destination server's IP address on the LAN. If the value of the isDMZEnabled parameter is false, this value is ignored. Otherwise, either this parameter or the destinationMACAddress parameter, but not both, must be specified. This value must be in the same subnet as the router's LAN host address (as defined by SetLANSettings), but not equal to the router's LAN host address and not fall inside the following reserved ranges:
Address Block Description Reference
192.168.1.0/24: 192.168.1.0 Subnetwork ID RFC 922, Section 7
192.168.1.0/24: 192.168.1.255 Subnetwork Broadcast Address RFC 922, Section 7
destinationMACAddress MACAddress yes The destination server's MAC address. If the value of the isDMZEnabled parameter is false, this value is ignored. Otherwise, either this parameter or the destinationIPAddress parameter, but not both, must be specified. The following restrictions from the IANA are applied to the destination MAC address. The destination MAC address must not fall inside the following reserved ranges:
Address Block Description Reference
00:00:00:00:00:00-00:00:00:00:03:00 Reserved RFC 5342
01:00:5e:00:00:00-01:00:5e:7F:FF:FF IPv4 multicast range RFC 1122
01:00:5e:80:00:00-01:00:5e:8F:FF:FF MPLS multicast range RFC 5332
01:00:5e:90:00:00 draft-ietf-mpls-tp-ethernet-addressing
FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF Broadcast address RFC 5342

Output Parameters

This action does not have any output parameters.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/SetDMZSettingsResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
ErrorInvalidDestinationIPAddress The specified destination server IP Address was invalid.
ErrorInvalidDestinationMACAddress The specified destination server MAC address was invalid.
ErrorInvalidSourceRestriction The first IP address in the specified source restriction range is invalid, or the last IP address in the range is less than the first IP address in the range.
ErrorMissingDestination Neither a destination server IP address nor a destination server MAC address were specified.
ErrorMultipleDestinations Both a destination server last IP address and a destination server MAC address were specified.
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/SetDMZSettings"

{
  "isDMZEnabled": true,
  "sourceRestriction": {
    "firstIPAddress": "192.168.10.1",
    "lastIPAddress": "192.168.11.1"
  },
  "destinationIPAddress": "192.168.1.200"
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK"
}

SetFirewallSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/SetFirewallSettings
This action sets the router's firewall settings.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
isIPv4FirewallEnabled bool no Whether the IPv4 firewall should be enabled.
isIPv6FirewallEnabled bool no Whether the IPV6 firewall should be enabled.
blockMulticast bool no Whether the firewall should block multicasts.
blockNATRedirection bool no Whether the firewall should block NAT redirections.
blockIDENT bool no Whether the firewall should block IDENT requests (port 113).
blockAnonymousRequests bool no Whether the firewall should block anonymous requests from the WAN, such as ping.
blockIPSec bool no Whether the firewall should block IPSec passthrough.
blockPPTP bool no Whether the firewall should block PPTP passthrough.
blockL2TP bool no Whether the firewall should block L2TP passthrough.

Output Parameters

This action does not have any output parameters.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/SetFirewallSettingsResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/SetFirewallSettings"

{
  "isIPv4FirewallEnabled": true,
  "isIPv6FirewallEnabled": true,
  "blockMulticast": false,
  "blockNATRedirection": false,
  "blockIDENT": true,
  "blockAnonymousRequests": true,
  "blockIPSec": true,
  "blockPPTP": true,
  "blockL2TP": true
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK"
}

SetIPv6FirewallRules

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/SetIPv6FirewallRules
This action sets the list of IPv6 firewall rules on the router. Any existing rules are completely replaced by the specified values.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
rules IPv6FirewallRule[] no The desired list of IPv6 firewall rules.

Output Parameters

This action does not have any output parameters.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/SetIPv6FirewallRulesResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
ErrorDescriptionTooLong One of the specified descriptions was longer than the maximum allowed length.
ErrorInvalidPort One of the specified ports was not between 0 and 65535.
ErrorInvalidPortRange One of the specified port ranges contained a first value that was greater than its last value.
ErrorNoPortRanges One of the specified rules contained no port ranges.
ErrorRulesOverlap Multiple rules were specified for a single port/protocol combination to the same IPv6 address.
ErrorTooManyPortRanges One of the specified rules contained more than the maximum allowed number of port ranges.
ErrorTooManyRules The specified list of IPv6 firewall rules contains more than the maximum allowed number of rules.
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/SetIPv6FirewallRules"

{
  "rules": [
    {
      "isEnabled": true,
      "ipv6Address": "2001:0DB8:85A3:0000:0000:8A2E:0370:7334",
      "portRanges": [
        {
          "protocol": "TCP",
          "firstPort": 3000,
          "lastPort": 3001
        }
      ],
      "description": "ports 3000-3001"
    }
  ]
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK"
}

SetPortRangeForwardingRules

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/SetPortRangeForwardingRules
This action sets the list of port range forwarding rules on the router. Any existing rules are completely replaced by the specified values.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
rules PortRangeForwardingRule[] no The desired list of port range forwarding rules.

Output Parameters

This action does not have any output parameters.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/SetPortRangeForwardingRulesResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
ErrorDescriptionTooLong One of the specified descriptions was longer than the maximum allowed length.
ErrorInvalidExternalPort One of the specified external ports was not between 0 and 65535.
ErrorInvalidExternalPortRange One of the specified external port ranges contained a first value that was greater than its last value.
ErrorInvalidInternalServerIPAddress One of the specified internal server IP addresses was invalid.
ErrorRulesOverlap Multiple rules were specified for a single external port/protocol combination.
ErrorTooManyRules The specified list of port range forwarding rules contains more than the maximum allowed number of rules.
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/SetPortRangeForwardingRules"

{
  "rules": [
    {
      "isEnabled": true,
      "firstExternalPort": 6888,
      "lastExternalPort": 6900,
      "protocol": "Both",
      "internalServerIPAddress": "192.168.1.150",
      "description": "BitTorrent"
    }
  ]
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK"

SetPortRangeTriggeringRules

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/SetPortRangeTriggeringRules
This action sets the list of port range triggering rules on the router. Any existing rules are completely replaced by the specified values.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
rules PortRangeTriggeringRule[] no The desired list of port range triggering rules.

Output Parameters

This action does not have any output parameters.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/SetPortRangeTriggeringRulesResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
ErrorDescriptionTooLong One of the specified descriptions was longer than the maximum allowed length.
ErrorInvalidForwardedPort One of the specified forwarded ports was not between 0 and 65535.
ErrorInvalidForwardedPortRange One of the specified forwarded port ranges contained a first value that was greater than its last value.
ErrorInvalidTriggerPort One of the specified trigger ports was not between 0 and 65535.
ErrorInvalidTriggerPortRange One of the specified trigger port ranges contained a first value that was greater than its last value.
ErrorRulesOverlap Multiple rules were specified for a single port.
ErrorTooManyRules The specified list of port range triggering rules contains more than the maximum allowed number of rules.
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/SetPortRangeTriggeringRules"

{
  "rules": [
    {
      "isEnabled": true,
      "firstTriggerPort": 12000,
      "lastTriggerPort": 12050,
      "firstForwardedPort": 12000,
      "lastForwardedPort": 12050,
      "description": "custom"
    }
  ]
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK"
}

SetSinglePortForwardingRules

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/SetSinglePortForwardingRules
This action sets the list of single-port forwarding rules on the router. Any existing rules are completely replaced by the specified values.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
rules SinglePortForwardingRule[] no The desired list of single-port forwarding rules.

Output Parameters

This action does not have any output parameters.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/SetSinglePortForwardingRulesResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
ErrorDescriptionTooLong One of the specified descriptions was longer than the maximum allowed length.
ErrorInvalidExternalPort One of the specified external ports was not between 0 and 65535.
ErrorInvalidInternalPort One of the specified internal server ports was not between 0 and 65535.
ErrorInvalidInternalServerIPAddress One of the specified internal server IP addresses was invalid.
ErrorRulesOverlap Multiple rules were specified for a single external port/protocol combination.
ErrorTooManyRules The specified list of single-port forwarding rules contains more than the maximum allowed number of rules.
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/SetSinglePortForwardingRules"

{
  "rules": [
    {
      "isEnabled": true,
      "externalPort": 3074,
      "protocol": "TCP",
      "internalServerIPAddress": "192.168.1.150",
      "internalPort": 3074,
      "description": "XBox Live (TM)"
    }
  ]
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK"
}

Structures

DMZSourceRestriction

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/DMZSourceRestriction
A range of IP addresses that are allowed to access the destination server in the DMZ.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
firstIPAddress IPAddress no The first IP address in the range. The following restrictions from RFC 5735 are applied to the first IP address. The first IP address must not fall inside the following reserved ranges:
Address Block Description Reference
0.0.0.0/8 "This" Network RFC 1122, Section 3.2.1.3
127.0.0.0/8 Loopback RFC 1122, Section 3.2.1.3
169.254.0.0/16 Link Local RFC 3927
224.0.0.0/4 Multicast RFC 3171
240.0.0.0/4 Reserved for Future Use RFC 1112, Section 4
255.255.255.255/32 Limited Broadcast RFC 919, Section 7  RFC 922, Section 7
lastIPAddress IPAddress yes The last IP address in the range. The following restrictions from RFC 5735 are applied to the last IP address. This value must be greater than or equal to the firstIPAddress value and not fall inside the following reserved ranges:
Address Block Description Reference
0.0.0.0/8 "This" Network RFC 1122, Section 3.2.1.3
127.0.0.0/8 Loopback RFC 1122, Section 3.2.1.3
169.254.0.0/16 Link Local RFC 3927
224.0.0.0/4 Multicast RFC 3171
240.0.0.0/4 Reserved for Future Use RFC 1112, Section 4
255.255.255.255/32 Limited Broadcast RFC 919, Section 7  RFC 922, Section 7

IPv6FirewallRule

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/IPv6FirewallRule
A rule describing port/protocol combinations that should be allowed to reach a specified IPv6 address on the LAN through the firewall. Only one rule can exist for a specific port/protocol combination at any given time.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
isEnabled bool no Whether the rule is enabled.
ipv6Address IPv6Address no The IPv6 address of the desination for which the traffic should be allowed.
portRanges PortRange[] no The list of port/protocol combinations that should be allowed. This list must contain at least one port range.
description string no A human-readable description of the rule.

PortRange

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/PortRange
A range of ports and an IP protocol.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
protocol IPProtocol no The protocol.
firstPort int no The first port in the range. This value must be between 0 and 65535.
lastPort int no The last port in the range. This value must be between 0 and 65535.

PortRangeForwardingRule

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/PortRangeForwardingRule
A rule describing a range of external ports that should be forwarded to a server on the LAN. Only one rule can exist for a specific external port/protocol combination at any given time.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
isEnabled bool no Whether the rule is enabled.
firstExternalPort int no The first external port in the range that should be forwarded. This value must be between 0 and 65535.
lastExternalPort int no The last external port in the range that should be forwarded. This value must be between 0 and 65535.
protocol IPProtocol no The protocol that should be forwarded.
internalServerIPAddress IPAddress no The IP address of the destination server on the LAN. This value must be in the same subnet as the router's LAN host address (as defined by SetLANSettings), but not equal to the router's LAN host address and not fall inside the following reserved ranges:
Address Block Description Reference
192.168.1.0/24: 192.168.1.0 Subnetwork ID RFC 922, Section 7
192.168.1.0/24: 192.168.1.255 Subnetwork Broadcast Address RFC 922, Section 7
description string no A human-readable description of the rule.

PortRangeTriggeringRule

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/PortRangeTriggeringRule
A rule describing a range of outbound ports that should trigger forwarding of inbound ports to the server on the LAN that made the outbound request. Only one rule can exist for a specific port at any given time.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
isEnabled bool no Whether the rule is enabled.
firstTriggerPort int no The first port in the range that should be trigger the rule. This value must be between 0 and 65535.
lastTriggerPort int no The last port in the range that should be trigger the rule. This value must be between 0 and 65535.
firstForwardedPort int no The first port in the range that should be forwarded by the rule. This value must be between 0 and 65535.
lastForwardedPort int no The last port in the range that should be forwarded by the rule. This value must be between 0 and 65535.
description string no A human-readable description of the rule.

SinglePortForwardingRule

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/SinglePortForwardingRule
A rule describing a single external port that should be forwarded to a server on the LAN. Only one rule can exist for a specific external port/protocol combination at any given time.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
isEnabled bool no Whether the rule is enabled.
externalPort int no The external port that should be forwarded. This value must be between 0 and 65535.
protocol IPProtocol no The protocol that should be forwarded.
internalServerIPAddress IPAddress no The IP address of the destination server on the LAN. This value must be in the same subnet as the router's LAN host address (as defined by SetLANSettings), but not equal to the router's LAN host address and not fall inside the following reserved ranges:
Address Block Description Reference
192.168.1.0/24: 192.168.1.0 Subnetwork ID RFC 922, Section 7
192.168.1.0/24: 192.168.1.255 Subnetwork Broadcast Address RFC 922, Section 7
internalPort int no The port number of the destination server on the LAN. This value must be between 0 and 65535.
description string no A human-readable description of the rule.

Enumerations

IPProtocol

http://linksys.com/jnap/firewall/IPProtocol
This service provides access to firewall settings on a router. IP protocols.

Enumeration Values

Value Description
TCP The TCP protocol.
UDP The UDP protocol.
Both Both the TCP and UDP protocols.
